meanings.definition: Punishment inflicted by dragging a person under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The pirate captain ordered the keelhaling of the disobedient crew member.
meanings.sent2: The keelhaling of the sailor was a brutal form of punishment at sea.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked that keelhaling would be a great way to teach someone a lesson about following orders.
meanings.sent4: The threat of keelhaling hung over the crew like a dark cloud, keeping them in line.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of keelhaling made everyone shudder at the thought.

meanings.definition: To punish by dragging under the keel of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain threatened to keelhale the sailor who disobeyed his orders.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, sailors would keelhale those who betrayed the crew.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor joked that he would keelhale his friend for playing a prank on him.
meanings.sent4: The idea of keelhaling someone for their mistakes seemed extreme to the new recruit.
meanings.sent5: The captain's stern voice warned that he would keelhale anyone who dared to mutiny.
